data.title: Android (x86) app closes after a few seconds running fine with SIGSEV
data.body:
Hi all!
I verified this with my "normal" app as well as with a minimum app only consisting of 1 label.
The segmentation fault only occurs when the app is exported with x86 support (and ARM). w/o x86 support it runs fine but much slower.

Godot version: 2.1.2.stable.official
Android version: 4.3 Jellybean (Device: Asus ME302C, 2GB RAM, dual core intel processor)

I get that error only on the X86 Device. It runs fine if I run the app in an emulator on an x86 PC.

Visible Error:
App starts and runs normal. But closes after around 10 seconds.

Some part of the dump:
```
03-31 12:34:21.390 10977 10990 F libc    : Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0x00000000 (code=128), thread 10990 (Thread-1485)
03-31 12:34:21.440 23186 23186 I DEBUG   : *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
03-31 12:34:21.440 23186 23186 I DEBUG   : Build fingerprint: 'asus/WW_epad/ME302C:4.3/JSS15Q
WW_epad-V5.0.21-20140701:user/release-keys'
03-31 12:34:21.440 23186 23186 I DEBUG   : Revision: '0'
03-31 12:34:21.440 23186 23186 I DEBUG   : pid: 10977, tid: 10990, name: Thread-1485  >>> org.godotengine.narrowbotsimulator <<<
03-31 12:34:21.440 23186 23186 I DEBUG   : signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 128 (SI_KERNEL), fault addr 00000000
03-31 12:34:21.530 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     eax 00000000  ebx 7a10facc  ecx 0039393f  edx 00000000
03-31 12:34:21.530 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     esi 000041b0  edi 00000000
03-31 12:34:21.530 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     xcs 00000073  xds 0000007b  xes 0000007b  xfs 00000000  xss 0000007b
03-31 12:34:21.530 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     eip 78f87167  ebp 0039393f  esp 7a4f590c  flags 00210246
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   : 
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   : backtrace:
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #00  pc 00087167  /data/app-lib/org.godotengine.narrowbotsimulator-2/libgodot_android.so (Main::iteration()+119)
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #01  pc 00050f81  /data/app-lib/org.godotengine.narrowbotsimulator-2/libgodot_android.so (OS_Android::main_loop_iterate()+33)
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #02  pc 0005e083  /data/app-lib/org.godotengine.narrowbotsimulator-2/libgodot_android.so (Java_org_godotengine_godot_GodotLib_step+3443)
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #03  pc 0007c24f  /system/lib/libdvm.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #04  pc 00000e0f  <unknown>
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #05  pc 000d7dfc  /system/lib/libdvm.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #06  pc 00000118  /dev/ashmem/dalvik-jit-code-cache (deleted)
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #07  pc 0008cd61  /system/lib/libdvm.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #08  pc 0010abbe  /system/lib/libdvm.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #09  pc 0010af17  /system/lib/libdvm.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #10  pc 000e8e2a  /system/lib/libdvm.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #11  pc 0001b55c  /system/lib/libc.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #12  pc 0003dcb5  /system/lib/libc.so
03-31 12:34:21.540 23186 23186 I DEBUG   :     #13  pc 000e8a7f  /system/lib/libdvm.so
```

If I understood this right (my android dev knowledge is very limited) that error presumably occured here:
```

	if (frame > 1000000) {
		if (GLOBAL_DEF("debug/stdout/print_fps", OS::get_singleton()->is_stdout_verbose())) {
			print_line("FPS: " + itos(frames));
		};
		Engine::get_singleton()->_fps = frames; //******here?*******
		performance->set_process_time(USEC_TO_SEC(idle_process_max));
		performance->set_fixed_process_time(USEC_TO_SEC(fixed_process_max));
		idle_process_max = 0;
		fixed_process_max = 0;

		frame %= 1000000;
		frames = 0;
	}
```

Funny thing is you declare "frames" in main.cpp as uint32:
`uint32_t Main::frames = 0;`

And in engine.h as float:
`float _fps; `

Could that case the problem in x86 code that you set a **float with an int**? Or did I get this wrong?

data.title: [Suggestion] Add get_drag_data as a signal
data.body:
`get_drag_data` apparently only works if you attach a script to a Control inherited node.  I'm suggesting the ability to use `get_drag_data` as a signal, example:

`control.connect("get_drag_data", self, "FunctionName")`

Very useful for dynamically created UI elements! Instead of attaching a `.gd` script to 64 Inventory boxes, we can just  connect a signal.  Not sure about performance, but I think it'd be nicer to work with

data.title: Ideas for future
data.body:
I reopen this issue because I was told some of these features are planned for 3.1, but no one told me which.
So, here's the original issue:

issue start
Please, add some AI facility such as: neural networks, behaviour trees. These should not be full implementations, but allow these to be implemented in scripting with ease.
Also, I don't know if terrains are still used today, but it would be cool to see them in.
Finally, physics should be enhanced with fluids and soft bodies.

Please, share your toughts.
issue end

Please, tell me what is planned for 3.1 from these.

Thanks in advance.

Bye, Ivano.

data.title: RigidBody interpolation
data.body:
Like in Unity:

https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Rigidbody-interpolation.html
https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Rigidbody2D-interpolation.html

My game looks so much smoother if I change the physics framerate to 144fps, but that's a bit overkill considering most people don't have 144hz monitors. Rigidbody interpolation would be a nice alternative.

data.title: Possible bug with Threading + HTTPClient
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x86 - Godot version 2.1.3 rc1

**Issue description:**
I want to make http requests in a non-blocking way, I made a small class that uses threads and the httpclient class. 
The request works sometimes yes and sometimes not, for example, a request that is processed fast will most likely come throu, but when requests start to take longer, it gets resolved but the game freezes.

Im using this to talk to a json api. And I will need to make multiple requests, so it cannot block the main thread.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I load the script as a singleton and use this code.

request.connect("127.0.0.1", 80)
var values = {"email": "example@live.com","password": "notsecurepassword"}
var login_request = request.post("/login", values)

**Files**
[request.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/891870/request.zip)

data.title: Previous value of time_left is added to wait_time before assigning to time_left
data.body:
Fixes #7530
This is my first contribution to the project, so I'm not sure whether I understood the issue correctly or not.

data.title: Dockable Container
data.body: I think a major UI improvement would be to implement a dockable container -- a container that can be dragged around and placed inside another dockable container, creating tabs. This would make the editor much more customizable.

data.title: Reenable Windows Desktop export
data.body:
This patch enables Windows Desktop export in the new export system.
Not much work here. Would be nice to get different icons for Windows Desktop and UWP export before 3.0

data.title: Fix more property names in _change_notify calls.
data.body: Follow up to #8219

data.title: Editor: Swap Scene and Import tabs in dock.
data.body: Swaps the ordering of those tabs. Now the editor defaults to displaying the scene tab instead of import, which I found a bit confusing.

data.title: DLScript module
data.body:
This is a first version of the DLScript module. It's fully usable, a few things need to be worked on though.

Most notably the editor integration is disabled by default because it's not that useful without in-editor reloading of libraries. I'll create a patch for that soon.
(If you want to use the editor features without reloading, you have to uncomment line 42 in module/dlscript/dlscript.h)

Some parts of the wrapper API are incomplete, adding those is a very easy task (junior-job maybe?).

data.title: clang-format style for Objective-C (.mm) files
data.body:
The current clang-format rules are not correct for Objective-C / .mm files.

We should either protect those files with `/* clang-format off */` comments to avoid having them changed by a too eager clang-format call, or (better) fix the rules so that they're properly styled and included in our scripts.

There are some ObjC-specific options in the clang-format documentation: http://releases.llvm.org/3.9.1/tools/clang/docs/ClangFormatStyleOptions.html

data.title: Edge detection shader?
data.body:
As godot 3.0 has ssao, I thought it might be possible to include something similar that does the opposite.... A shader which adds a highlight on edges, with a blur as like ssao would be pretty cool!

I found the following code:
http://ikstewa.blogspot.com.au/2012/07/real-time-image-based-edge-detection.html
https://github.com/ikstewa/edge-detection

data.title: SSAO doesn't play well with smooth shading
data.body:
Tested on Godot 3.0 af282b56feb8d84049f911dd1d91d82bd2211727
Windows 10 64 bits nVidia GeForce 940M

I generated a smooth mesh out of voxels, it looks smooth, but SSAO makes its edges appears anyway:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/24593525/aca75f4a-1824-11e7-8cf5-6bc9adc628a8.png)

I understand it's based on depth, in which case it will indeed make "edges" stand out. But what's the point of having a smooth mesh then? Is there any way of using the normals to improve this?

Also, borders of the screen got affected by SSAO too, it doesn't looks right.

Could be related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/8120

data.title: Fix failing to compile shader on Adreno GPU
data.body:
Adreno 430 GPU (on Android) complains when starting 3D scene.
```
I/Adreno(31169): ERROR: 0:108: 'min' : no matching overloaded function found 
I/Adreno(31169): ERROR: 0:109: 'min' : no matching overloaded function found 
I/Adreno(31169): ERROR: 0:110: 'min' : no matching overloaded function found 
I/Adreno(31169): ERROR: 0:111: 'min' : no matching overloaded function found 
I/Adreno(31169): ERROR: 0:141: '=' :  cannot convert from 'const int' to 'float'
I/Adreno(31169): ERROR: 0:143: '=' :  cannot convert from 'const int' to 'float'
I/Adreno(31169): ERROR: 0:143: '<' :  wrong operand types  no operation '<' exists that takes a left-hand operand of type 'float' and a right operand of type
```

data.title: theme mods. reomoved border, changed stylebox for top part, tabs left aligned
data.body:
I changed some style box numbers so that there is no border at the left and right anymore. I think it looks really cool especially combined with a new theme. to get an idea how this looks checkout this issue:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7294

I also would love to implement bold font since that would make a nice addition to the overall editor look.

But I'm not sure how I can achieve that with minimal changes.
since the make_default_theme function only takes one param for the font. so I would need to change that. also I'm not quite sure how the font pipeline works.
I think I just add the otg file and SCons than adds that file to the font header. than it is a available as a global var stating with _

would be cool if someone can give me some help and explanation how to add bold font to the default editor theme.

I'm not sure if this is the same with other textures for the theme, but there are currently still a couple of minor issues with positioning of ui elements, they are sometimes to close to the ground. So we might need to do some position changes to the editor node.
Would be happy for any possible help.

data.title: Godot doesn't render objects correctly
data.body:
Hello.
Godot doesn't render correctly all the objects created in here:
https://ghostbin.com/paste/quj9s
I found this issue to happen in version 2.2 of godot, haven't tested the other versions but I think the issue will happen in other versions except version 3 because it has new renderer too (maybe it will happen is version 3 too).
It uses this library: https://github.com/Zylann/godot_opensimplex but i don't think it is a problem of the library.
here is the problem that occurs:
https://gfycat.com/NegativeValuableBaleenwhale
Seems like it only occurs when the number goes more than a specific number, when testing, the number for me and someone else was different but at 100*100 we both had this problem.
Here is also a scene that you can download and shows this issue:
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/212250894228652034/297829430015819776/tester.tscn
To see the problem, rotate the camera with your mouse.
Why is this happening?
Thank you.

data.title: Input: Update Gamepad mappings. [2.1]
Input: Update Gamepad mappings.
Viewport: Fix undefined behaviour found by llvm sanitizer.
data.body:
When godot was running as the project manager, it tried to call a method on a null pointer (`get_tree()->get_edited_scene_root()`).
This is undefined behaviour and caused a crash when compiled with sanitizing enabled.

data.title: Shape Colision Editor Suggestions
data.body:
There are good options already. I suggest others.

![8p](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9745229/24584864/48df9b8a-1752-11e7-91df-331f73709444.png)

If press right mouse button:
  Erase this collision shape 
When mouse drag:
  Expande a new shape from the point of click.
And if Snap selected, this draw is aligned with the grid.

**Or else**:
Height and Width of Collision shape in the inspector also makes it easier to fit into the grid.
